Legal_Issue: Whether the Federal Court has jurisdiction over claims of negligence and breach of contract against customs brokers when the main claim is against the Crown
Application_Facts: Plaintiffs claimed damages for negligent advice from customs officials and breach of contract by customs brokers; no factual intertwining with the Crown's claim
Decision_Outcome: Federal Court lacks jurisdiction; claim against customs brokers struck out
Remedy_Requested: Damages for incorrect customs advice leading to business losses
Court_Ruling: Claim dismissed; customs brokers awarded costs
Legal_Standard: Jurisdiction requires federal law basis or factual intertwining with Crown claim
Assessment_Factor: Presence of federal law, factual connection to Crown
Procedural_Issue: Motion to strike out due to lack of jurisdiction
Application_Basis: No federal law or factual intertwining found
Governing_Rule: Federal Court jurisdiction limited to federal law claims or factually intertwined matters
Evidentiary_Deficiency: No evidence of federal law basis or factual connection to Crown
Outcome: Claim dismissed, costs awarded to defendants
Harm_Assessment: Business losses alleged due to incorrect customs advice
Cause_Description: Plaintiffs sought damages for incorrect customs advice leading to business losses
Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over non-federal claims
Decision_Rationale: No applicable federal law or factual intertwining with Crown claim
Legal_Standard_Applied: Jurisdiction under Federal Court based on federal law or factual intertwining
